description: This course draws on multiple theoretical perspectives to introduce students to the fundamental principles of multi-modal communication design in its social context. Students will analyze, design, and produce images and hypertext for use in a variety of digital platforms, including e-learning and business applications.
title: Designing Digital Images and Hypertext
prerequisites: Level at least 2A Arts and Business Co-op students.
notes: [Note: For Arts and Business Co-op students: The materials produced in this course will become part of a student's ongoing Digital Portfolio.]
subject: DAC

description: This course introduces students to the principles of designing time-based multi-modal communication in a social context. Students will analyse, design, and produce video for use in a variety of digital platforms, including e-learning and business applications.
title: Designing Digital Video
prerequisites: Level at least 2A Arts and Business Co-op students.
notes: [Note: For Arts and Business Co-op students: DAC 201 recommended. The materials produced in this course will become part of a student's ongoing Digital Portfolio.]
subject: DAC

description: In this course students will learn advanced digital design theory. They will participate in workshops with professional designers, develop specialized digital materials and contribute signature work to their Digital Portfolio.
title: Special Topics in Digital Design
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: In this course, students will be introduced to sound analysis and production. Students will learn to record, edit, and implement sound in a variety of linear and non-linear media forms, with emphasis on film and video games.
title: Designing with Digital Sound
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This course teaches students the principles and practices of telling stories using Machinima: namely, the use of 3D computer graphic engines to design short movies. Students will learn to develop and present story ideas, create storyboards, write short scripts, and then render their narratives using a variety of digital techniques and tools.
title: Machinima as Digital Storytelling
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: A project-based course in which teams of students design and prototype educational multimedia applications for on-campus courses. Students will develop an understanding of the following as they relate to educational multimedia: its potential and limitations, steps in the development process, components of an effective design, and the learning process relevant to mediated learning.
title: Designing Learning Activities with Interactive Multimedia
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This is a project-based course in which interdisciplinary student teams will design and prototype a computer simulation or game for learning using a three-dimensional game engine. Projects will address real world educational challenges proposed by clients including University of Waterloo faculty or staff members.
title: Designing Computer Simulations and Games for Learning
prerequisites: Level at least 3A Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This course introduces fundamental design skills for two-dimensional interactive media, with special attention on video games. Students will learn to theorize, design, prototype, and test digital interactive creations as a form of entertainment and communication.
title: Design for Interactive Games
prerequisites: Level at least 3A Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This course focuses on the creative, technical, and artistic challenges inherent to creating visual content (film, photos, graphics) for the increasingly ubiquitous out-of-home digital displays. The size, configuration, placement, and functions of these public digital displays require new artistic and technical techniques to fully exploit their capabilities. In the course, students will explore the design affordances of several types of public digital display as well as produce dynamic, interactive content for them.
title: Digital Display Systems
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This course explores film studies from a production perspective. Through the art of imitation, students will explore some of the major artistic, technical, and communicative advances in film history and turn this knowledge toward (re-)creating and modifying key cinematic techniques in their own productions. Students will learn an explicit and replicable theoretical vocabulary for analysing film technique, as well as engage in practice by creating short films of their own, illustrating, extending, and modifying those same techniques.
title: Cinematic Art and Practice
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: This course introduces students to the theory and practice of user experience design as it applies to the design of interactive digital media. Topics will include user-centred design, personas, iterative testing, prototyping, information gathering interviews, and contextual inquiry.
title: User Experience Design
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: In this course, students will be introduced to design and production of digital business presentations. They will develop specialized digital materials and contribute work to their Digital Portfolio.
title: Digital Presentations
prerequisites: Level at least 3A Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC

description: Students will work in small groups under the supervision of a faculty researcher on an ongoing, large-scale, digital design project.
title: Digital Design Research Project
prerequisites: DAC 300/ENGL 303; Arts and Business Co-op students
subject: DAC

description: In this course students will learn advanced digital design theory as it applies to speech communication. They will develop specialized digital materials and contribute work to their Digital Portfolio.
title: Special Topics in Speech Communication and Technology
prerequisites: Level at least 3A Arts and Business Co-op students only.
subject: DAC
